newsitem.title: USA: Abraxas commodity prices firm until mid-Q3.
newsitem.headline: Abraxas commodity prices firm until mid-Q3.

text.p: Abraxas Petroleum Corp said Monday that it expects commodity prices to remain firm through the summer, which will support its 1997 drilling and development program.

The company said that of the 106 wells planned for 1997, 23 are planned for drilling in the second quarter, and that it is already ahead of its capital expenditure program for the year, having spent $10.7 million versus a budgeted $6.4 million.
The company said that its average daily production for the first quuarter was 14,213 barrel of oil and equivalents, an 86 percent increase from the year-earlier level.
Abraxas also said that the consensus estimate from the seven analysts who follow the company is is for a full year average daily production of about 15,000 barrels.
Abraxas is a crude oil and natural gas exploration and production company that also processes natural gas.
